intro: Leucheria concinna, commonly known as the narrow-leafed leucheria, is a species of flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or white. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation efforts.
